entry.title: The Export Control (Uzbekistan) Order 2010
entry.summary: Council Regulation (EU) No 1227/2009 repeals Council Regulation (EC) No 1859/2005 (“the Original Regulation”) as a result of the Council of the European Union’s decision not to renew restrictive measures (which included an arms embargo) against Uzbekistan.

entry.title: The Terrorism Act 2000 (Proscribed Organisations) (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: Part 2 of the Terrorism Act 2000 makes provision about proscribed organisations (including setting out offences in relation to such organisations in sections 11 to 13). An organisation is proscribed if it is listed in Schedule 2 to that Act or operates under the same name as an organisation so listed (section 3(1)). Article 2 of this Order adds “Al Shabaab” to the list in that Schedule.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Light Dues) (Amendment) Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Merchant Shipping (Light Dues) Regulations 1997 by substituting a lower figure (41p instead of 43p) for the rate at which light dues are payable for any one voyage by a ship which ends at a port or place in the United Kingdom on or after 1st April 2010 (regulation 2(a)). Regulation 2(b) makes a corresponding downward adjustment in the maximum amount payable for any one voyage.

entry.title: The Specified Sixth Form College Corporation Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order specifies the sixth form college corporations to which section 33J(2) of the Act applies.

entry.title: The South Kent College, Folkestone (Dissolution) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order dissolves with effect from 31st March 2010 the further education corporation established to conduct South Kent College, Folkestone. It provides for the transfer of its property, rights and liabilities to West Kent College, Tonbridge, Kent and secures the rights of its employees by applying section 26(2) to (4) of the Further and Higher Education Act 1992.

entry.title: The Registration Services (Fees, etc.) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend fees payable under the Registration Services (Fees, etc.) (Scotland) Regulations 2006 in connection with services provided under the Marriage (Scotland) Act 1977 and the Civil Partnership Act 2004.

entry.title: The Zoonoses and Animal By-Products (Fees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Zoonoses and Animal By‑Products (Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2009 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The UK Borders Act 2007 (Commencement No. 6) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order brings into force section 24 (seizure of cash) of the UK Borders Act 2007 on 1st April 2010. Section 24 (seizure of cash) applies Chapter 3 of Part 5 of the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 (recovery of cash) to an immigration officer as it applies in relation to a constable.

entry.title: The Portland Harbour Revision Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order authorises Portland Harbour Authority Limited to construct works at the harbour including quay walls, reclamation of land and facilitates permanent mooring of a floating dry-dock.

entry.title: The National Health Service (General Medical Services Contracts, Primary Medical Services Section 17C Agreements and Primary Medical Services Performers Lists) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (General Medical Services Contracts) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (“the GMS Regulations”), the National Health Service (Primary Medical Services Section 17C Agreements) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (“the Section 17C Regulations”) and the National Health Service (Primary Medical Services Performers Lists) (Scotland) Regulations 2004 (“the Performers Lists Regulations”).

entry.title: The Corporation Tax Act 2009 (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order exercises power conferred by the Corporation Tax Act 2009 to undo changes. The Acts affected are the Taxation of Chargeable Gains Act 1992 (article 2) and the Corporation Tax Act 2009 itself (article 3).

entry.title: The Field Allowance for New Oil Fields Order 2010

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Field Allowance for New Oil Fields Order 2010

entry.summary: This Order provides for a deep water gas field to be a qualifying oil field for the purposes of Schedule 44 to the Finance Act 2009 (c. 10) (supplementary charge: reduction for certain new oil fields) (“Schedule 44”).

entry.title: The Civil Enforcement of Parking Contraventions Designation (No.2) (West Sussex) (Chichester and Crawley) Order 2010
entry.summary: This order designates part of the area of The West Sussex County Council as a civil enforcement area for parking contraventions and as a special enforcement area for the purposes of Part 6 of the Traffic Management Act 2004.

title.div: The Council Tax (Prescribed Classes of Dwellings) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau'r Dreth Gyngor (Dosbarthau Rhagnodedig ar Anheddau) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: These Regulations are made in accordance with section 12 of the Local Government Finance Act 1992. These Regulations amend certain provisions of the Council Tax (Prescribed Classes of Dwellings) (Wales) Regulations 1998 to provide that armed forces personnel who are required to live in accommodation provided by the Ministry of Defence to perform the duties of their office come within the definition of those with job-related dwellings. This means that where those persons also have a second home in Wales for which they are liable to pay council tax, the billing authority for the area within which the second home is situated is prevented from reducing the discount on that dwelling from 50%.

Gwnaed y Rheoliadau hyn yn unol ag adran 12 o Ddeddf Cyllid Llywodraeth Leol 1992. Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio darpariaethau penodol yn Rheoliadau'r Dreth Gyngor (Dosbarthau Rhagnodedig ar Anheddau) (Cymru) 1998, i ddarparu bod personél y lluoedd arfog, pan yw'n ofynnol eu bod yn byw mewn llety a ddarperir gan y Weinyddiaeth Amddiffyn er mwyn cyflawni dyletswyddau'u swyddi, yn dod o fewn y diffiniad o rai sydd â'u hanheddau'n berthynol i'w swyddi. Effaith hyn, pan fo gan y personau hynny ail gartref yng Nghymru ac yn atebol i dalu'r dreth gyngor arno, yw rhwystro'r awdurdod bilio ar gyfer yr ardal y lleolir yr ail gartref ynddi rhag lleihau'r disgownt ar yr annedd honno islaw 50%.

title.div: The Animals (Divisional Veterinary Managers) (Wales) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Anifeiliaid (Rheolwyr Milfeddygol Rhanbarthol) (Cymru) 2010

div.p: These Regulations replace references to “Divisional Veterinary Manager” with “Welsh Ministers” in–

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn disodli cyfeiriadau at “Rheolwr Milfeddygol Rhanbarthol” â chyfeiriadau at “Gweinidogion Cymru” ac, fel y bo'n briodol, yn disodli cyfeiriadau at “Divisional Veterinary Manager” â chyfeiriadau at “Welsh Ministers” yn—

entry.title: The Initial Sixth Form College Corporation Designation (England) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order designates certain corporations within the further education sector as sixth form college corporations.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Travelling Expenses and Remission of Charges) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2010
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (Travelling Expenses and Remission of Charges) (Scotland) (No.2) Regulations 2003 (“the Regulations”).

entry.title: The First-tier Tribunal (Gambling) Fees (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order amends the First-tier Tribunal (Gambling) Fees Order 2010 (“the 2010 Order”). The 2010 Order specified the fees payable when bringing an appeal to the First-tier Tribunal under section 141 or 337(1) of the Gambling Act 2005.

entry.title: The Value Added Tax (Refund of Tax to Museums and Galleries) (Amendment) Order 2010
entry.summary: This Order, which comes into force on 1 March 2010, amends the Value Added Tax (Refund of Tax to Museums and Galleries) Order 2001 S.I.2001/2879 (“the 2001 Order”). The 2001 Order specifies the bodies that are entitled, under section 33A of the Value Added Tax Act 1994 (c. 23) (“section 33A”), to claim a refund of the VAT incurred by them that is attributable to the provision of free admission to specified museums and galleries which they operate.

title.div: The Accounts and Audit (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2010 / Rheoliadau Cyfrifon ac Archwilio (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2010

div.p: These Regulations amend the Accounts and Audit (Wales) Regulations 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”). The 2005 Regulations make provision with respect to the accounts and audit of local government bodies in Wales whose accounts are required to be audited in accordance with Part 2 of the Public Audit (Wales) Act 2004 Act (“the 2004 Act”) (other than local probation boards).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Cyfrifon ac Archwilio (Cymru) 2005 (“Rheoliadau 2005”). Mae Rheoliadau 2005 yn gwneud darpariaeth o ran cyfrifon ac archwilio cyrff llywodraeth leol yng Nghymru y mae'n ofynnol i'w cyfrifon gael eu harchwilio yn unol â Rhan 2 o Ddeddf Archwilio Cyhoeddus (Cymru) 2004 (“Deddf 2004”) (ac eithrio byrddau prawf lleol).
